title: Updated 110.0 (64bit)  Tiny fonts and menu's after updating  (Good Bye FireFox!)
content:
This is the first and last time I've posted to Moz:lla.

After updating to 110.0 the fonts on my tabs and menu's are TINY!!! As are the fonts on web sites. (Among several formatting / display issues after the update.) After spending over 4 hours researching / adjusting font size in settings, pixels in "about:config" and other adjustments, tabs and menus are somewhat readable again. But most of my websites still DO NOT DISPLAY CORRECTLY!!!! This is ridiculous!!! STOP CHANGING USER SETTINGS AT UPDATES! This is simple incompetence as it's NOT the first time I've experienced this problem with an update. After using Fifefox for almost 20 years I'm DONE. This is supposed to be a an easy to use, productivity enhancing, browser.....at least it used to be. The sites that don't display in Firfox are fine when viewed in Chrome or Edge....meaning the problem IS WITH THE FIREFOX UPDATE....AGAIN! Migrating to Chrome so I can spend my time working on my system rather then repairing Firefox.
creator: Paladin921

title: Can no longer see or customize extensions on toolbar!
content:
All of my extensions just got moved into a single new extension button. I understand this feature was just added to 109 but is quite terrible.

I can no longer see my extensions on the toolbar. I now have to do even more clicks to access certain options or settings. Which is dumb as it now takes longer to get where you need to go.

This is a terribly added feature. Not sure how this passed. The quality of life is not improved in any shape or form with this. Only makes things worse.

For example. I have norton safe web and search. I now have to click on the extension button to see if a page is safe or now have to do multiple clicks to access that extension.

This new feature is terrible and I really hope it is reverted.

title: Device specific sync settings on same account?
content: Hi, I'm using my personal Firefox account at work, but would like to only sync passwords and open tabs. When I change the sync settings in Firefox at the work computer, the corresponding sync settings are also applied to my private devices (Windows PC, Android tablet and phone), meaning my bookmarks, history and everything isn't synced between my private devices. However, I'd like to keep synchronization on for everything on all private devices, just not for the work pc except for passwords and open tabs. Isn't there a way to have device specific synchronization settings when logged into the same account? Or is it that whenever I change which items to sync, it gets applied to my Firefox account and therefore is applied to all devices I'm logged in? Sorry if I worded it weirdly, let me know if there's something hard to understand in my text. Thank you!

title: Very long "Waiting to transmit the response" times shown in profiler
content:
Hi,

I encountered an issue where I was getting really slow performance from a server, and I ruled out the server's query as being the issue. I ran the performance profiler, and I found that virtually all of the time was spent in the "Waiting to transmit the response" phase, found in the Network tab of the profile, when hovering over a long bar. In many cases, it was taking over 15 seconds, and there wasn't much information at all being sent from the server.

My question is, what exactly does that phase of the request cover? Could it involve the server not sending data fast enough? A network issue (DNS, proxies, etc.)? The client being low on resources at that moment?

Also, can someone please provide me a list of possible other areas of the profile, or anywhere else, to check to help me narrow down the cause of slow performance in this specific area?

Thanks!
creator: jmyszka
